data.title: Good show!
data.text: Theatre Albany is housed in a beautiful mansion with majestic pillors, built in the style of the old South, but it has the modern equipment to mount large plays and musicals.  The show I saw was well-mounted and very entertaining.  I'd definitely come back to see another production.

data.title: Quality community theatre is hard to come by in a small town...
data.text:
...but Theatre Albany fits the bill for SouthWest Georgia! With a full slate of shows each year, this award-winning company contributes a great deal to the cultural life of our community.  Plus, they often include parts for young people, enabling them to get valuable experience performing live theatre.
A great place for a date night, or the occasional family-friendly activity...So thankful they keep producing quality entertainment!

data.title: Veterans Park Amphitheater Downtown
data.text: When we visited this park it was Labor Day.  Not too many people around as there wed no events happening.  There were people enjoying the park however.  Some were jogging and walking along the walking trail.  Others like us were reading the memorials to Veterans.  Very nice tributes and very nice place to  sit and reflect.  We walked the trail to the back side of the Ray Charles Plaza but turned around because there is still construction on the new bridge.

data.title: Out of Date
data.text: We went to each show our first year here in Albany.  But, alas, I am sad to say we are not inclined to return.  The actors are fine, the production is good (quite good actually), the sets are also quite good.  But, the choice of plays to present are the problem.  Outdated and not relevant or nostalgic.  It would be fun to see a familiar show done by local actors.  Or, a new modern production that is relevant to our times.  We get neither here.  Nun-sense was enjoyable, and fit what we were hoping to get.  But it stopped there.  We will keep our eyes on the place, but we will have to see something that gets us excided.  This is a gem for the town, and I truly hope that they are able to find a way to appeal to a larger segment of the population then current.  Otherwise, I fear they will not be with us much longer.

data.title: Excellent Theatre
data.text: This small town theater troupe is a winner; literally they have won acting contest consistently for many years. The plays they put on are very diverse in nature and appeal to most audiences. Hey, if you're very lucky you might even see me trod the boards.

data.title: A delightful highlight to our roadtrip - Great Live Theater !
data.text:
Prior to our southern Georgia road-trip, I researched for live theater performances in the area, as that is a favorite activity for us.  I found that the THEATRE ALBANY was in fact running a performance of "Steel Magnolias", also a favorite.  A quick call to the very friendly person in their box office, and we had reservations for the Sunday afternoon matinee, along with driving directions.  The tickets were surprisingly reasonable in price as well.

On arrival, we found the theater is housed in an enchanting old southern home, with a roomy auditorium, boasting tiered, comfortable seating and not a bad seat in the house.  The entire performance was professionally presented, the sound, staging etc. was perfect, and the acting was exceptional.  What talent is within this small community theater group !  We were told that they have been in operation for 80 years, and I can see why! They put their heart, soul, time and talents into offering up a quality performance to delight their audience.   If you have any opportunity to visit Albany, or to do as we did and "side-trip" through the town, check out their schedule.  They have a season of perhaps six shows, and each runs for a couple of weeks.
